oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Homer Geiger to his mother regarding being gassed in combat
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: In this letter on Red Cross stationary from Geiger to his mother, he tells her about being gassed and now recuperating in hospital. He writes that he hopes to by home, or at least back in the U. S. by January 15, 1919. Homer Geiger served in Btry. B, 114th Field Art., 30th Div. Btry. B consisted of men from Chattanooga and had previously been a Tennessee National Guard unit. The 30th Div. was composed of National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas.
